body_html:
I couldn't reproduce it

I added the following to top of https://github.com/yaroslavvb/stuff/blob/master/svd_benchmark.py and ran it as svd_benchmark.py eigh and observed the same time.

import tensorflow as tf
sess = tf.Session()
ret = tf.py_func(np.linalg.svd, [np.random.randn(2, 300)], [tf.float64, tf.float64, tf.float64])
for i in range(10): sess.run(ret)

py_func runs the function provided in the main Python interpreter, so a simpler repro would be to run np.linalg.svd directly rather than through py_func.

Also numpy backend may matter here, you can check with python -c 'import numpy; numpy.__config__.show()'

body:
I couldn't reproduce it

I added the following to top of https://github.com/yaroslavvb/stuff/blob/master/svd_benchmark.py and ran it as `svd_benchmark.py eigh` and observed the same time.

```
import tensorflow as tf
sess = tf.Session()
ret = tf.py_func(np.linalg.svd, [np.random.randn(2, 300)], [tf.float64, tf.float64, tf.float64])
for i in range(10): sess.run(ret)
```

`py_func` runs the function provided in the main Python interpreter, so a simpler repro would be to run `np.linalg.svd` directly rather than through py_func. 

Also numpy backend may matter here, you can check with `python -c 'import numpy; numpy.__config__.show()'`
